pageContext.claim: “African American youth unemployment -- so important -- a number that, three years ago, when I was running, was through the roof...It recently reached the lowest rate ever recorded. Youth unemployment. So important. ”
pageContext.analysis: African-American youth unemployment did hit a record low 15.7 percent in August 2019, but it has bumped up five points since then. It was 20.3 percent in November. Plus, Trump says the youth unemployment rate was “through the roof” when he was running. There’s no question it was high, but it had already declined by more than half since the peak of the recession.
